page.title: 09SCHOOLS (1)
page.content: There are four schools within the D-block. There is an Infant School in Stow catering for 5-7 year-olds and a Junior School for the 8-11 age range. These are both County Schools and the buildings date from 1897 for the Infants and 1901 for the Juniors, although they were originally all-age.While they are substantially built, they lack the benefit of modern educational thinking and plumbing! The Infant School was designed for 120 boys when it was built and the Junior School for 288 girls and infants, but it is unlikely that these numbers were ever realised. In 1907 the average attendance was 90 boys, 80 girls and 80 infants. Now the numbers are between 60 and 70 at both schools, practically half what it was twenty years ago. At age 11 children transfer to either
